articles.title: This Dividend King Is on Track to Join the $1 Trillion Club. Is It a Buy?
articles.content: Walmart has quietly outperformed the retail sector, reporting strong quarterly results with impressive growth across its business segments. The company's market cap has now topped $700 billion, putting it on the path to joining the trillion-dollar club. Walmart's valuation may seem high, but its competitive advantages and growth opportunities make it an attractive investment option.

articles.title: Billionaire Warren Buffett's Bet On Domino's Pizza Looks Primed to Deliver Returns for Decades to Come
articles.content: Warren Buffett's investment in Domino's Pizza aligns with his investing philosophy of focusing on established consumer brands with steady cash flow and growth potential. Domino's has shown consistent same-store sales growth, and its brand recognition makes it a compelling long-term investment opportunity.

articles.title: Will Reddit Be Worth More Than Apple by 2030?
articles.content: Reddit, a fast-growing online forum, has seen its stock price balloon by over 170% since its IPO, reaching a market cap of over $24 billion. While the company has shown impressive growth, the article suggests that it may be challenging for Reddit to match the long-term success and brand recognition of tech giant Apple.

articles.title: 1 Unstoppable Growth Stock That Could Join Nvidia, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft in the Trillion-Dollar Club By 2040
articles.content: The article discusses Shopify, an e-commerce specialist, as a potential trillion-dollar stock by 2040. It highlights Shopify's growth, profitability, and competitive advantages, suggesting it could join the ranks of tech giants like Nvidia, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft.

articles.title: How Much Will Apple Pay Out in Dividends in 2025?
articles.content: Apple has raised its dividend for 13 consecutive years, and there's a good chance investors could see another raise coming in 2025. The company's current dividend yield is 0.44%, and legendary investor Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway holds a significant stake in Apple, earning $75 million in quarterly income from the dividend.

articles.title: Here's My Top Stock to Buy Right Now
articles.content: Alphabet (Google's parent company) is the author's top stock pick, citing its steady advertising business, growing cloud computing and AI offerings, and undervaluation compared to peers. The author believes Alphabet is well-positioned for growth in 2025 despite concerns over a potential DOJ lawsuit.

articles.title: 32.4% of Warren Buffett's $292 Billion Portfolio Is Invested in 4 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks
articles.content: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has invested in four companies that are leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) in their operations: Domino's Pizza, Amazon, Coca-Cola, and Apple. These investments make up 32.4% of Buffett's $292 billion portfolio.

articles.title: Indian regulator rejects Apple request to put antitrust report on hold
articles.content: India's antitrust body has turned down a request from Apple to put a hold on an investigation report which found the company breached competition laws, allowing the case to continue, an internal order from the regulator seen by Reuters showed.  The Competition Commission of India (CCI) in August ordered a recall of investigation reports after Apple said the watchdog had disclosed commercial secrets to competitors in the case dating back to 2021, including Tinder-owner Match.  The CCI internal order showed that Apple in November alleged that the main complainant in the antitrust investigation - Indian non-profit Together We Fight Society (TWFS) - had not complied with the directives to give an assurance that the old investigation reports had been destroyed.

articles.title: Is Apple Inc. (AAPL) Still a Key Fixture in Warren Buffett’s Portfolio?
articles.content: We recently published a list of Warren Buffett’s 10 Longest-Held Stocks. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against other Warren Buffett’s longest-held stocks. Warren Buffett has cemented his legacy as Wall Street’s most successful investor. During the high-flying stock market of the 1960s, he leveraged […]

articles.title: Warren Buffett Keeps Dumping Apple Shares: Here's the Stock He Is Buying Instead
articles.content: The Oracle of Omaha now owns more than 3% of a powerhouse restaurant brand.
